docs.name: Balance Sheet of Monetary Authority
docs.description: The People's Bank of China (PBC) was established on December 1, 1948 based on the consolidation of the Huabei Bank, the Beihai Bank and the Xibei Farmer Bank. In September 1983, the State Council decided to have the PBC function as a central bank. The Law of the People's Republic of China on the People`s Bank of China adopted on March 18, 1995 by the 3rd Plenum of the 8th National People's Congress has since legally confirmed the PBC`s central bank status.

docs.description: Money Supply in billions of redenominated Rubles. M2 is defined as total cash in circulation (outside banks) and balances in the domestic currency on accounts of resident non-financial organizations, financial organizations (except for credit ones) and individuals.

docs.name: U.S. Monthly Coincident Index
docs.description: Coincides with U.S. economic cycles. Historical data begins in 1919.

docs.name: U.S. Monthly Lagging Index
docs.description: Lags cyclical turns in U.S. economic activity. Historical data begins in 1948.

docs.name: U.S. Weekly Leading Index
docs.description: Has a moderate lead over cyclical turns in U.S. economic activity. Historical data begins in 1967.

docs.name: Percentage of High School Students aged 16 or older who are Employed by hours worked- Total
docs.description: Percent employed includes those who were employed but not at work during the survey week. Hours worked per week refers to the number of hours the respondent worked at all jobs during the survey week. The estimates of the percentage of high school students ages 16 years old and older who worked less than 15 hours per week or 15 or more hours per week exclude those who were employed but not at work during the survey week. Therefore, detail may not sum to total percentage employed.

docs.name: Dropout Rate by Race
docs.description: Total includes other race/ethnicity categories not separately shown.

docs.name: Number of Undergraduates Enrolled by Race and Sex - Male
docs.description: Figures after 2010 are projections. Values are in thousands of enrolled.

docs.name: WHO / UNICEF Joint Monitoring Program for Water Supply and Sanitation; Populations (Number of People X 1000) - Afghanistan
docs.description: Units = Number of People X 1000. The WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply and Sanitation is the official United Nations mechanism tasked with monitoring progress towards the Millennium Development Goal (MDG) relating to drinking-water and sanitation (MDG 7, Target 7c), which is to: Halve, by 2015, the proportion of people without sustainable access to safe drinking-water and basic sanitation. An improved drinking-water source is defined as one that, by nature of its construction or through active intervention, is protected from outside contamination, in particular from contamination with faecal matter. To allow for international comparability of estimates, JMP uses a classification to differentiate between 'improved' and 'unimproved' drinking-water sources as well as sanitation.

docs.name: Budapest RAX Index
docs.description: To indicate the trends of the capital market the stock exchange calculates domestic and regional equity indices as well as a yield index.

docs.name: Budapest DWIX Index
docs.description: To indicate the trends of the capital market the stock exchange calculates domestic and regional equity indices as well as a yield index.

docs.name: Budapest BUX Index
docs.description: The BUX index is the official index of blue-chip shares listed on the Budapest Stock Exchange Ltd. It is calculated in real time by the BSE every five seconds based on the actual market prices of a basket of shares. The index shows the average price changing of the shares with the biggest market value and turnover in the equity section. Hereby this is the most important index number of the exchange trends. BSE was one of the first in the world who started to use free-float capitalisation weightings instead of the traditional market capitalisation weightings in October 1999. The BUX index is also a tradeable index. Its futures and option products are available in BSE's derivatives section.

docs.name: Zagreb Stock Exchange Bond Index: CROBIS
docs.description: CROBIS is an official Zagreb Stock Exchange bond index. The ZSE started publishing it on October 1, 2002. The base date of the index is September 30, 2002 and the base value is set on 100. CROBIS is price index weighted by market capitalisation. The weight of any individual bond issue in CROBIS is limited to 35% of the index capitalization. Once a day after the close of trading session. Average daily prices weighted by traded volume, are used for the calculation. If a bond was not traded on the given day, the previous average price is used.

docs.name: Zagreb Stock Exchange Stock Index: CROBEX10
docs.description: CROBEX10 is an official Zagreb Stock Exchange share index. The ZSE will start publishing it on September 7, 2009. The base date of the index is July 31, 2009 and the base value is set on 1000. CROBEX10 is weighted by free float adjusted market capitalization. The weight of any individual issuer in CROBEX10 is limited to 20% of the index capitalization. If a share was not traded on the given day, the previous last price is used.

docs.name: Zagreb Stock Exchange Bond Index: CROBISTR
docs.description: CROBIStr is an official Zagreb Stock Exchange bond index. The ZSE started publishing it on December 2, 2011. The base date of the index is December 1, 2011 and the base value is set on 100. CROBIS is total return index weighted by market capitalisation. The weight of any individual bond issue in CROBIStr is limited to 35% of the index capitalization. Once a day after the close of trading session taking into account accured interest and coupon payment. Average daily prices weighted by traded volume, are used for the calculation. If a bond was not traded on the given day, the previous average price is used.

docs.name: Quito Stock Exchange Indices
docs.description: This index reflects price changes on the stock market and incorporates an adjustment factor. The weights are revised every six months, and the index at the start of the semiannual period is the value of the index on the last day of the preceding semiannual period. The general index is calculated daily, after the exchange closes for the day.

docs.name: Amman Stock Exchange Index: Technology and Communication
docs.description: ASE indices are used to portray the pattern of stock price movement, and to measure the performance of the ASE in terms of return. Back in 1980, the Amman Financial Market (AFM) constructed an Unweighted Price Index supplemented by sub-indices for the four sectors: Banking and Finance Companies, Insurance, Services and Industrial. At that time 38 stocks were covered and a base value of 100 was stipulated on the opening session of January 1st 1980 for the Unweighted Price Index. The base was changed to 1000 as of January 1st 2004. More info at http://www.ase.com.jo/en/main-indices.

docs.name: Amman Stock Exchange Index: Glass and Ceramic Industries
